stories.title: IBM adds side order of NLP to McDonald's AI drive-thru chatbots

stories.text:
Both Thunderbird (w/ TbSync) and Evolution work fine for basic calendar stuff.

However, when comparing to Apple Calendar, they seem to lack two crucial features: - calendar delegation (sharing with other users) - meeting invitation; the events do show, but I can't way to change one's attendance status

It seems to me that at least one software capable of doing this should exist. Am I missing something? Is CalDav just a broken protocol whose full implementation is doomed to remain just a sweet dream?
stories.title: Ask HN: GNU/Linux calendar software handling CalDav delegation and invitation?
